name: Ensure to turn off and clear event listeners after component is destroyed
description: The rule will raise a violation when event listener is not turned off after component is destroyed
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: When listening to events with $on, we should always remember to remove that listener with $off on destroyed(). This prevents us from having memory leaks.
total: Number of VueJS source code setting up an event listener
alternativeName: Ensure to clear event listeners after components are destroyed to prevent memory leaks

qualityStandards.name: Storable and Member Data Element Reference Missing De-Referencing Control Element
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by enforcing proper release of used data elements.

Consequence
Software featuring known under-efficient coding practices requires excessive computational resources

qualityStandards.name: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime
qualityStandards.description: The software does not sufficiently track and release allocated memory after it has been used, which slowly consumes remaining memory.

qualityStandards.name: Use of Object without Invoking Destructor Method
